episodeTitle: Smash the Wave! Luffy and Zoro, The Strongest Combo!
description: The Rocketman races through the Aqua Laguna as Luffy and Zoro combine their powers to blast through the massive tidal wave. Meanwhile, on the Puffing Tom sea train, Sogeking makes his debut to help Sanji and Franky rescue Robin from CP9.

events.title: T Bone Shows Compassion to Injured Marine
events.description: Marine Captain T Bone notices a Marine with an injured arm and asks how he got the wound. When the Marine explains it was from a bug bite, T Bone tears a piece from his own cape to bandage the wound, demonstrating his honorable and caring nature.
events.significance: Introduces T Bone as one of the most genuinely honorable Marine officers in the series, establishing his character as someone who abhors needless violence and cares for his subordinates.

quotes.text: How did you get that injury on your arm?
quotes.speaker: T Bone
quotes.context: T Bone asking a Marine about his wound before helping him

events.title: Wanze Debuts on the Sea Train
events.description: Wanze, a CP7 agent and chef, makes his first appearance skating across the kitchen car of the Puffing Tom with his food trolley. He specializes in Ramen Kenpo, a bizarre martial art involving creating ramen from flour and kneading dough in his mouth.
events.significance: Introduces a unique and comedic fighting style in One Piece. Wanze serves as an obstacle for the Straw Hats trying to reach Robin on the Sea Train.

events.title: Nero's First Appearance
events.description: Nero, known as 'Nero the Sea Weasel', makes his debut as the newest CP9 agent. He appears on the Puffing Tom escorting Nico Robin to Enies Lobby, demonstrating his mastery of four Rokushiki techniques (Soru, Geppo, Kami-e, and Rankyaku).
events.significance: Introduces a new CP9 member who will later be revealed as insufficiently trained, leading to his expulsion by Rob Lucci. His presence escalates the danger level for the rescue mission.

events.title: Franky Family Attempts to Stop Aqua Laguna
events.description: The Franky Family fires their special cannons at the massive Aqua Laguna tidal wave in an attempt to break through it, but even their most powerful weapons fail to make a dent in the enormous wave.
events.significance: Demonstrates the overwhelming power of the Aqua Laguna, establishing the scale of the challenge that Luffy and Zoro will need to overcome. It also shows the Franky Family's loyalty and determination.

events.title: Gomu Gomu no Sanbyaku Pound Cannon Debut
events.description: Luffy and Zoro execute their first-ever combination attack, the Gomu Gomu no Sanbyaku Pound Cannon (300 Pound Cannon). Luffy asks Zoro what 108 times 2 is, and Zoro answers 216. Luffy thinks the name is too long, so they agree to round it up to 300. Their combined attack tears a massive hole straight through the Aqua Laguna wave, allowing the Rocketman to pass through safely.
events.significance: This is the first major combination attack between Luffy and Zoro in the series, showcasing their teamwork and combined power. The scene demonstrates their ability to overcome seemingly impossible obstacles and has become one of the most iconic moments in the Water 7 arc.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy asking Zoro to calculate the combination attack name

quotes.text: That's too long! Let's make it 300!
quotes.speaker: Luffy

quotes.text: Gomu Gomu no Sanbyaku Pound Cannon!
quotes.speaker: Luffy and Zoro
quotes.context: The duo launching their combination attack

events.title: Rocketman Successfully Passes Through Aqua Laguna
events.description: After Luffy and Zoro create an opening in the massive tidal wave, the Rocketman sea train speeds through the hole and successfully makes it past the Aqua Laguna. The passengers rejoice at their miraculous survival.
events.significance: This success allows the rescue mission to continue toward Enies Lobby. It demonstrates the Straw Hats' determination to save Robin regardless of the obstacles in their way.

events.title: Sanji Contacts the Rest of the Crew
events.description: Sanji successfully makes contact with the main group on the Rocketman and fills them in on his current situation aboard the Puffing Tom sea train. He updates them on their progress in pursuing Robin.
events.significance: This communication helps coordinate the two groups' efforts to rescue Robin and keeps everyone informed of the mission's progress.

events.title: Usopp Refuses to Help Rescue Robin
events.description: When Franky tells Usopp to help rescue Robin, Usopp initially refuses, stating that he is no longer a member of the Straw Hat Pirates and shouldn't get involved in saving her. This shows Usopp still struggling with his departure from the crew.
events.significance: This moment highlights Usopp's internal conflict and pride after leaving the crew. Despite his refusal, he will soon act to help them anyway, showing his true feelings.

events.title: Sogeking's Debut
events.description: When a Marine spots Sanji and Franky on top of the Puffing Tom, the Marine is suddenly shot into the water. A masked hero appears and introduces himself as Sogeking, the sniper from Sniper Island. He performs his iconic Sogeking theme song. In reality, this is Usopp in disguise wearing a gold sun-like mask and red cape, though Luffy and Chopper don't recognize him.
events.significance: This marks one of the most iconic character transformations in One Piece. Sogeking allows Usopp to help his former crewmates while maintaining his pride. The persona becomes legendary among fans and represents Usopp's courage and determination. Despite everyone (except Luffy and Chopper) knowing it's Usopp, they play along out of respect for his feelings.

quotes.text: I am Sogeking! The sniper from Sniper Island!
quotes.speaker: Sogeking
quotes.context: Sogeking's first introduction to Sanji and Franky

events.title: Sogeking Uses Metallic Star
events.description: Shortly after his introduction, Sogeking demonstrates his sniping abilities by using a Metallic Star attack to shoot a Marine into the water, saving Sanji and Franky from being spotted.
events.significance: Establishes Sogeking's combat capabilities and shows that despite the disguise, Usopp's skills and weapons remain the same.

quotes.text: That's too long! Let's make it 300!
quotes.speaker: Luffy

quotes.text: Gomu Gomu no Sanbyaku Pound Cannon!
quotes.speaker: Luffy and Zoro

quotes.text: I am Sogeking! The sniper from Sniper Island!
quotes.speaker: Sogeking

themes.description: The episode showcases the power of working together, particularly through Luffy and Zoro's first combination attack. Their ability to coordinate and combine their strengths demonstrates the importance of teamwork in overcoming impossible obstacles.
themes.symbolism: The Gomu Gomu no Sanbyaku Pound Cannon represents the synergy between the crew's strongest fighters and their willingness to trust each other completely.

themes.description: The massive Aqua Laguna represents an overwhelming natural force that seems impossible to overcome. Yet through their determination and teamwork, Luffy and Zoro find a way to break through, continuing their mission to save Robin.
themes.symbolism: The Aqua Laguna symbolizes the seemingly insurmountable challenges the crew faces, while breaking through it represents their unwavering resolve.

themes.description: Usopp's debut as Sogeking explores themes of pride, identity, and the lengths people go to maintain their dignity while still doing what's right. Though he refuses to help as Usopp, he creates an alter ego to assist his friends.
themes.symbolism: The Sogeking mask represents Usopp's need to separate his pride from his desire to help his friends, allowing him to reconcile his internal conflict.
culturalReferences: The concept of masked heroes is common in Japanese tokusatsu (special effects) shows and superhero media

themes.description: T Bone's introduction showcases a Marine officer who embodies honor and compassion, contrasting with the typical portrayal of Marines as antagonists. His care for his subordinates demonstrates that good people exist on all sides.
themes.symbolism: T Bone tearing his cape to bandage a wound symbolizes self-sacrifice and genuine care for others.

characterSpotlights.development: Demonstrates his willingness to combine his powers with his crewmates and his simple but effective approach to problem-solving (rounding 216 to 300).
keyActions: Coordinates with Zoro for combination attack
Leads the Rocketman passengers to safety
quotes: That's too long! Let's make it 300!
Gomu Gomu no Sanbyaku Pound Cannon!

characterSpotlights.development: Shows his perfect synchronization with Luffy and his ability to work as part of a team despite his lone wolf tendencies.
keyActions: Coordinates with Luffy for combination attack
Helps break through Aqua Laguna with Hyakuhachi Pound Ho
quotes: Gomu Gomu no Sanbyaku Pound Cannon!

characterSpotlights.role: Former crew member turned masked hero
characterSpotlights.development: Usopp transforms into Sogeking, allowing him to help his friends while maintaining his pride. This shows his growth in finding creative solutions to his internal conflicts.
keyActions: Initially refuses to help rescue Robin
Saves Sanji and Franky from Marines
quotes: I am Sogeking! The sniper from Sniper Island!

characterSpotlights.development: Continues his mission to rescue Robin, maintaining contact with the main group and working alongside Franky despite their differences.
keyActions: Contacts the crew on the Rocketman
Works with Franky to pursue Robin

characterSpotlights.development: Introduced as a uniquely compassionate Marine who cares for his subordinates and abhors needless violence, setting him apart from typical Marine antagonists.
keyActions: Tears piece from his cape to bandage subordinate
quotes: How did you get that injury on your arm?

characterSpotlights.development: Debuts as a comedic yet dangerous opponent with his bizarre Ramen Kenpo fighting style.
keyActions: Guards the Sea Train kitchen car

characterSpotlights.development: Introduced as a seemingly competent CP9 member, though future episodes will reveal his inadequate training.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expanded the Aqua Laguna sequence with more dramatic visuals and extended the Luffy-Zoro combination attack scene for greater impact.
Sogeking's theme song featured an elaborate music video sequence in the anime that was not present in the manga, becoming one of the most iconic anime-original additions.

trivia.fact: Episode 257 features one of the most iconic combination attacks in One Piece history - the Gomu Gomu no Sanbyaku Pound Cannon. The attack is actually mathematically incorrect (108 x 2 = 216, not 300), but Luffy rounds it up because he thinks 216 is too complicated.

Sogeking's debut in this episode became so popular that the character gained a cult following among fans. Many fans playfully insist that Sogeking and Usopp are different people, maintaining the gag from the series.
This episode adapts manga Chapter 367 and marks the beginning of the Sea Train battle sequence that would continue through the Enies Lobby arc.

T Bone, who debuts in this episode as one of the most honorable Marines in the series, would later be killed during the Egghead Arc for the bounty placed on him by the Cross Guild, making his compassionate introduction particularly tragic in hindsight.
The episode aired on February 26, 2006 in Japan and achieved a TV rating of 10.9%, ranking #3 in its timeslot.

Wanze's Ramen Kenpo (Ramen Martial Arts) is one of the most bizarre fighting styles in One Piece, involving him eating flour, kneading it in his mouth, and extracting noodles through his nose to create weapons.
Nero debuts as a CP9 member in this episode, but he is unique among CP9 agents in that he only mastered 4 of the 6 Rokushiki techniques (Soru, Geppo, Kami-e, and Rankyaku), lacking Tekkai and Shigan.
